page.title: 18Royal Scottish Nat. Hospital
page.content: Because of its central location in Scotland,Larbert was chosen for the site of the Royal Scottish National {Hospital.}It is used for the profoundly{mentally handicapped}.There is an adult section to the west of Larbert and a juvenile section to the north.The hospital is convenient for Larbert station and this gives relatively easy access to most cities and large towns in Scotland.Next to it is Bellsdyke psychiatric hospital with short term ,long term and geriatric patients.The hospitals were built in Victorian times and are costly to maintain,heat and modernise etc.They are an important source of employment to the local people as doctors, nurses,cleaners,ambulance men,gardeners etc. are required,some on a shift basis to provide a round the clock service.
